I learned a lot from field trips.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: I audited this class but still feel like I got a lot out of it. What I was mainly looking to get was an understanding of the geostatistical background that underlies the operations in ArcGIS and I definitely feel like I learned this. It would be great if Dana could get involved with this course to make it more ArcGIS focused as well.
I was auditing the class

Q3: This course does not have much assigned work throughout the term, which allows you to apply the material to you term project dataset. For me, this was an optimal model that provided more than enough to do, as well as assignments that were functionally more useful and interesting than they might otherwise have been.Q12: For anyone interested in GIS, remote sensing, or geospatial analysis, this course is a must. Spatial statistics are absolutely fascinating, and lend themselves well to other geospatial analysis.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: I really enjoyed the lab session where we got to work with data with professors available to help. I wish we had more of these.
N/A
The work structure, in which I was able to apply each week's topics to a dataset of my choosing.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: N/A

There is so much to cover in spatial statistics that the course must move along a a reasonable pace. While for the most part it was just fine, I wish it had been a tiny bit slower so that I could really solidify some of the difficult concepts.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: N/A

Only one "lab" in which we worked on our datasets in a class setting. I think additional sessions like that could be helpful, as it is useful working in the presence of others who are struggling with similar issues.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: It didn't; i took the course to learn more about spacial statistics and how to apply GIS

My studies have been geared toward geospatial technologies and analysis, and this course was an essential component in providing an analytical foundation to many of the techniques I already employed but didn't understand.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: To learn more about spacial statistics
See above.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes definitely.
Yes
Yes. I wish I could take it again though, to help seat the material a little more deeply in my memory.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: N/a

This course is amazing - one of the best I took in my two years as an FES student. It is a perfect compliment to Dana Tomlin's GIS courses and provides many conceptually fascinating tools with which to analyze data. Tim and Jonathan play a nice tag team, and between the two you get great exposure to a variety of techniques and excellent in-class discussion. Both are humble in acknowledging that spatial statistics are complicated, and that neither of them know them as well as some of the other more traditional branches of statistics. This is great, and helps the students put their struggles of the concepts in perspective. I would take this course again if I could.
